line.en: 'I'm hungry...'
'They're still not back yet...? They must be\nworking hard.'
'Is there anything in the fridge...?'
'Quack Quack'
'Wassup, senior Hat? What's wrong, are you hungry\ntoo?'
'Quack! Quack!'
'It's not food you're after? So, do you want a\nwash?'
'Quack...'
'I see. I see.'
'It's quite cool today, isn't it? I'll be OK to\nwear more than just my underwear.'
'Quack!'
'OK, OK, you want a wash. Let's go!'
'Quack!'
'Looks like it feels nice. I'll have a shower\nlater too.'
'Quack, Quack!'
'Hey, senior Hat. What's that?'
'Quack?'
'Look, at the sky...'
'...Doesn't it seem faintly purple?'
'The direction is...'
'East!'
'Which means...!'
The eastern sky was bluish-purple.
We were tidying up after finishing flight\ntraining for the day, but we stopped working to\ngaze at the eastern sky.
'This is a sign... isn't it?'
This was the moment we'd been waiting for, but we\nwere careful not to get our hopes up yet.
'We don't know. But until now, it hasn't been\nthat color.'
'Well, I don't know. At least not since we\nstarted paying attention to it.'
'The air temperature is 25 degrees centigrade.\nThat's 3 degrees lower than yesterday!'
'The overall temperature is quite high... and\nthere is a breeze. This could be it.'
We all look towards Amane.
Amane looks to the eastern sky...
She was just standing there quietly.
While looking at the signs that indicated that\nthe phenomenon could occur, she seemed to be\nassessing the situation.
Or maybe she was praying...
'Amane!'
'It might occur tomorrow morning.'
There are two days left of the summer holidays.
This was the time limit for Amane's activities\nwith the Soaring Club.
'Amane?'
'I... I know... yeah, I'm OK...'
I gave Kotori a prod and spoke quietly to her.
'(The second in charge should take care of\noccasions like this.)'
'(Y...yes, you're right!)'
'Ahem... Listen up, everyone.'
'The Morning Glory will definitely be occurring\ntomorrow morning! That is what we believe!'
'That is why today, regardless of whose turn it\nis, we will all wake up before dawn, and prepare\nfor flight!'
'Alright!'
It's 4 AM.
'Don't make too much noise. Kanako is still\nsleeping.'
'Roger that.'
'ROGER... Agh!'
'Kotori!'
'S...sorry...'
We got up at the usual time for people whose turn\nit is to watch the dawn sky, and carried our\nthings outside the dormitory.
There is still one hour before the morning sun\nrises.
We have to complete our launch preparations\nbefore then.
'It's quite cold, isn't it...?'
'It's a little chilly to be wearing such light\nclothes.'
'Amane, will you be alright in those clothes?'
'Yeah... I'll be fine.'
'Look lively, Amane! You'll soon be flying above\nthe clouds.'
'Kotori, you're speaking really loudly. Ageha,\nhow's the sky?'
'Hmm... I don't really know.'
The sky was covered in darkness, and it wasn't\npossible to see with the naked eye whether or not\nthere were any clouds.
'Anyway, let's hurry. If we hang about for too\nlong, we won't make it in time for dawn.'
We reach the runway and immediately begin work on\nthe assembly.
'Right aileron.'
'OK.'
'Left aileron.'
'No problems.'
'Next, is the elevator.'
While this is going on, I eat a rice ball that I\nhad made the night before.
I have to do something about my empty stomach.
'Amane, what have you been doing since just now?'
'Sorry... It's nothing, really.'
'We'll be fine, I'm sure it will go well. Here,\nhave a rice ball, and liven up a bit!'
'Yeah, thanks.'
'Aoi, how's it looking?'
'I don't know. In the training, I've finally\nfigured out how to catch the thermals.'
The highest we've flown in training has been 600\nmeters.
We won't be able to reach the Morning Glory at\naltitudes like that.
Suddenly, a strong wind blows.
'Aoi, apply the dive breaks!'
'Got it!'
When the glider is on the ground, lift will be\ncreated if wind hits the main wings.
With winds this strong, if we're careless, the\naircraft might start floating upwards.

That's why we make use of the equipment used to
reduce lift during landing. If the lift is at a
low level, it will be OK even if the wind hits
it.
'It's suddenly become very windy, hasn't it? This\ncould be because of the Morning Glory.'
It said in the book that when this occurred in\nBurketown, Australia, raging winds were blowing\nbeneath the clouds.
'We'll need to use a crosswind launch...'
Of course, when strong winds blow from the side,\nthe glider will be blown with them, so we need to\nuse a special technique for take off.
We haven't practiced it much but we should be OK.
'Look, dawn is breaking!'
The eastern sky became dimly bright.
Also, the conditions of the sky became clear.
'Look at the clouds over there!'
Dawn hadn't broken yet and the sky was still\ngloomy, but we could see the outline of the\nclouds.
These clouds could be called Morning Glory and\nwere fine and delicate and looked like they could\ndisappear any minute.
'Kotori, prepare for launch!'
'Roger!'
Everyone quickly got into position.
Amane and I got into our seats in the cockpit.
'The crosswind is really strong, Aoi.'
'OK. I'll use full rudder from the start!'
I push down on the rudder pedal even though we're\nnot moving yet.
If we are hit with a crosswind during take off,\nthe glider's nose will face into the wind. This\nis called the weathervane effect.
By turning the rudder in the opposite direction,\nwe can reduce the weathervane effect.

However, because the rudder has almost no effect
until we pick up speed, we need to push the
rudder pedal before launch and gradually release
it as we accelerate.
'(This is the first time we've taken off in such\nstrong winds.)'
This kind of feels like a rehearsal, but we have\nto do it.
'The runway is clear!'
Ageha came to let us know that there were no\nobstructions on the runway.
Then, moving round to the side of the glider, she\nlifts up the left wing. A little higher than\nusual.
The wind is blowing from the front-right\ndirection.
If the wings are horizontal during take off, the\nwind from the side will go under the right wing,\nmessing up the balance.
That's why we need to launch with the right wing\na little lower, to stop the crosswind from going\nunder it.
To maintain the bank angle at which Ageha is\ntilting it, I move the yoke to the right, to\noperate the right aileron.
'Launch preparations complete. Here we go,\nAmane!'
'...Yeah.'
Amane replied nervously.
I give the thumbs up to signal to Ageha outside.
'Launch preparations complete. Lift it up,\nKotori!'
KREEEEEAK...
The moment Ageha gave the signal, the winch\nstarted moving, as if it couldn't wait.
The glider steadily accelerates.
I pull back on the yoke.
'It's all up to you, Aoi!'
Leaving behind Ageha, who was holding up the wing\nand running with us, the glider floated into the\nair!
'Ugh!'
The glider wobbled like crazy when the crosswind\nhits it!
'Are you OK, Aoi, Amane?'
'We're OK, we've leveled out!'
'S...somehow, we're alright.'
'Roger!'
As we accelerate, the ailerons start working, and\nwe are able to maintain the bank according to the\ncrosswind.
Tilting the rudder in the direction of the\nincoming wind, the glider steadily rises into the\nsky.
'Unnnh... our airspeed is really fast! We're\nclimbing much more quickly than usual!!'

Even if it looks like we're flying at the same
speed, if the headwind is strong, the speed of
the wind hitting the glider, in other words, the
airspeed is different.
When the airspeed is high, lift increases, which\ncauses the aircraft to rise.
Today, the wind is strong.
The power of the winch pulling us, fights against\nthe power of the main wings lifting us up,\ncausing the glider to shake.
'Releasing!'
Just before passing over Kotori's head, who is\noperating the winch, I released the tow rope.
Whooosh...
Freed from the force that was holding us down,\nthe glider was suddenly thrown up into the air!
I immediately turn around to check that the tow\nrope has been released.
'Release confirmed. The launch is a success.'
'OK!'
I check the altitude on the altimeter.
We are currently 300 meters above the ground.
Then, I looked up to the sky above.
Outside the dome-shaped canopy, all I could see\nwas sky.
A sky changing from night to morning.
Indigo, orange and pale yellow... the morning sun\npaints a complex gradient as far as the eye can\nsee...
...and there, in the middle, a straight line of\nclouds stretched out.
'Amazing...'
I felt like I was being sucked into it as I\nstared at this spectacle.
'Hmm? What are those clouds?'
'Wow. You're right, what are they? They're very\nunusual clouds, aren't they? They look just like\nsomeone has painted them.'
'If that were the case, they're not painted very\nwell.'
'That's not true. I think they're really pretty.\nIt's a good painting.'
'Hah! As always, you'll praise anything, won't\nyou? ...Hmm?'
'Hey, sis. What's that...?'
'Huh? ... Something is flying up there?'
'Could it be?'
'...The glider that we saw before!'
'What are they doing so early in the morning, I\nwonder?'
'They're flying... aren't they?'
'I can see that. That's not what I mean.'
'Well, they're trying to go over there, aren't\nthey?'
'Over there?'
'See? To those clouds.'
'It's so pretty...'
'Yeah...'
'It's so mysterious... How could something like\nthis occur?'
'It really is like a miracle.'
'But isn't it a bit different to that photo?'
'Yeah...'
'Isn't it going to get even bigger?'
'I dunno...'
'Where are Aoi and Amane?'
'Wait a sec. I'll look through the binoculars.'
'Ummm... Ah, there they are!'
'Where, where?'
'See? Above the lake. It just shone!'
'Grrr... Whoaaaa...!!'
Clutching the yoke, I somehow manage to maintain\nour position.
'The airflow is getting really rough! It's taking\neverything I've got just to keep our position!'
On days where the airflow is stable, I only need\nto hold onto the yoke lightly.
However, in these rough skies, the glider is\nshaking all the time, and we don't know when it\nwill be hit with sudden winds.
I need all my concentration as the glider takes\nthe wind.
'Are you OK, Aoi?'
'I...I'm fine! More importantly, can you search\nfor some thermals, Amane?'
'Understood!'
Amane looks outside the canopy, to search for\nplaces where thermals may occur.
Clouds are the markers used for finding thermals.
Clouds are formed when the warm upward drafts are\ncooled in the sky.
Therefore, thermals are usually below them.
As I watch the variometer, I fly based on\nguesswork.
The variometer is one of the instruments in the\nglider, and tells us whether it is rising or\ndescending based on atmospheric pressure.
If there is a sudden change in the variometer,\nit's possible that we've entered a thermal\nwithout realizing.
'There's no reaction, huh?'
The reaction from the variometer was slow, and\nthe glider was gradually descending.
'There, it's a cloud!'
Amane called from the front seat.
'Where?'
'Ummm... four o'clock!'
'Roger!'
I pull the yoke to the right and push the rudder\npedals, and the glider turns.
'Hrrrn... the rudder feels heavy...!'
When the ailerons or the rudder take strong\nwinds, they become heavier, but that means that\ntheir effect is stronger.
'Is that it?'
In my field of vision, I can see the small cloud\nAmane had found.
It was a small, fine, elongated cloud.
'Please let this work...!'
I feel like I'm praying as I fly under the cloud.
We continue for a while and we don't seem to be\nhitting any thermals.
After all, we can't see them, so we don't really\nknow if they are there or not.
'Where is it!?'
I go to turn, so that we can head towards another\narea, then...
Whooosh...
'Whoa!!'
Suddenly, the left wing lifts up, tilting the\naircraft.
'Aoi, this is...!'
'Yes, I know!'
This wasn't the feeling of being shaken by a\ncrosswind.
A rising thermal grazed the wings.
I quickly turn the rudder to the left.
The variometer reacts. The glider was rising.
'We've entered a thermal!'
As we confirmed that, I continued to turn the\nglider.
Thermals extend upwards through the atmosphere,\nlike a pillar.
In most cases, the strongest lift is in the\ncenter, known as the core.
Normally, it gradually gets weaker the further\nyou go towards the outside.
That's why, If you want to climb higher, you have\nto get as close to the core of the thermals as\npossible.
I turn the glider to search for the core.
The variometer tells us that we are rising. We\nare getting closer and closer to the core.
'Looks like we've entered the core.'
said Amane as she looked at the instruments.
I try to keep the glider circling in the same\narea, in an attempt to rise in the core of the\nthermal.
'Alright, we're climbing.'
Through the seat, I felt that the glider was\nrising.

'It's jokingly called the 'Ass meter' but you can
feel all sorts of G forces through the seat, and
is one of the sensations that are important for
piloting a glider.

That's because the thing that informs of you of
the glider's reactions the quickest is not the
instruments, it's the seat that is in direct
contact with your body.
While getting a positive response, and not\nwanting to lose it, I paid close attention while\noperating the controls.
'They're rising!'
'Looks like they were able to ride a thermal.'
'Aoi! Aoi!'
'Aoi's busy right now.'
'Amane, it looks like it's going well!'
'Yeah. Right now, we are rising on a thermal. Our\naltitude has reached 500 meters.'
'Yes, c'mon!'
'It seems like the airflow is getting rough, but\nhow about the sky above you?'
'It's pretty rough but we'll be alright. Aoi is\ndoing his best.'
'It seems like it's all going according to plan.'
'Keep going, go above the clouds!'
'We really want to do that but...'
'Huh? What's wrong?'
'If we rise a little higher, we'll leave this\nthermal.'
'Eh? Why?'
'The lift is weak, and our rate of climb is slow.\n... At this rate, we won't make it.'
'We won't be able to rise any higher here.'
The G forces that felt so strong at first, were\nnow getting weaker.
We'd risen to a certain extent, but we were now\njust maintaining the current altitude.
If we stay here like this, the thermal might grow\nand we might be able to gain stronger lift.
Well, if we think about the time, it's quite\nlikely that will happen.

This is because thermals get bigger as the
sunlight hits the earth, which heats quicker than
the air, and with this level of heat, the air
close to the ground warms up, causing thermals to
occur.
Since last night was so cool, when the morning\nsun hits the earth, more and more strong thermals\nwill start rising.
But we don't have time for that.
If we wait a little longer for the sun to come up\ncompletely, the Morning Glory will disappear.
'We're getting out of this thermal!'
'Understood.'
As we look up to the Morning Glory in the\ndistance, we flew out of the thermal.
'We've traveled pretty far, haven't we?'
Thermals are often thought to extend straight up\nlike a pillar through the air, but actually they\ndon't go straight up.
In the same way that smoke is blown by the wind,\nthermals twist when hit by wind from the side.
While we were climbing in the thermal that was\nleaning to one side because of the wind, we've\nmoved further away from the Morning Glory.
The Morning Glory doesn't just stay in one place.
It is rotating as it rolls, moving across the\nlake.

If it gets too far away, then we'll have no means
of catching up with it other than 'falling' to
increase our propulsion, which makes things
difficult.
'Increasing speed.'
I push the yoke forward, pointing the nose\ndownwards.
While sliding down on the air, the glider\naccelerates.
'Unhh... Uhh...'
Whenever the nose is pointed downwards, the\nground always comes into view.
Amane, who is scared of heights, stifles her\nscreams.
'Amane, we'll be OK! This glider will not fall,\nI'll make sure of that!'
'...It's falling.'
'Huh? No way! That can't be! See, it's flying!'
'But, the altitude is decreasing again. So they\nleft the thermal. In this situation, that might\nhave been a wise decision...'
'Thermal?'
'Hey, what's a thermal?'
'...It's nothing.'
'But they are still descending. They have to find\nthe next thermal quickly.'
'Grrrr!'
'We've caught up with it.'
'But we've lost a lot of altitude.'
To get back the altitude that we'd lost, we\nsearch for the next thermal.
In theory, they occur more easily above ground\nthat looks like soil, or wide areas of asphalt,\nlike parking lots.
'How about over there?'
Amane pointed towards the runway from which we\nhad taken off.
It was a wide area of soil, in the sunlight. It\ncertainly met the conditions needed for thermals\nto be made easily.
'Alright!'
'Huh? They're coming back! Are they planning on\nlanding?'
'Could it be that there's a problem?'
'Aoi, Aoi! What's wrong? Did something happen?'
'Don't panic, we're just searching for thermals!'
'So you don't have a problem?'
'That's right!'
'Phew...'
'But at this time, it must be hard to find\nthermals...'
'It's good if you have the perfect places, or\nclouds that look like thermals will form near\nthem.'
'Are there any other signs?'
'Hmm... The only other thing is to actually try\nflying into them...'
'Unnh... but they're so close!'
'Pass me the binoculars! I'll try searching to\nsee if anything's out there!!'
We did get some lift above the runway after all.
But it was weak.
It wasn't enough to raise the heavy double-seater\nglider.
It must be because the ground hasn't warmed up\nenough to create strong thermals.
'Dammit... Aren't there any around here?'
In the meantime, the glider is gradually\ndescending.
'Whooooah!!'
'Waah!'
Then, the wind came.
Perhaps because of the influence of the Morning\nGlory, the airflow is being disturbed.
The glider wobbles as it is hit by the strong\nwinds, temporarily reducing the lift, and causing\na drop in altitude.
I start to feel impatient.
'...Should we have stayed over there after all?'
'But, if we'd done that...'
The cloud from before was moving even further\naway from the direction we want to head in.
Even if we can rise to the altitude we need, we\nwould be too late.
How much time has passed since we took off?
Meanwhile, the sky has become brighter and has\nchanged from the morning glow to light blue.
'Looks like we can't reach it...'
Amane mumbled to herself...
...while looking up at the passage of cloud,\nstretching across the sky.
'No, that's not true! It's right in front of us!'
'I guess so...'
'I'll... We'll do something about it!'
Kotori and Ageha were also looking for clouds,\nfrom the ground.
We haven't reached the time limit yet.
'They're losing a lot altitude. They can't find\nany thermals.'
'Ooooh... What will they do? At this rate, they\nwon't reach those pretty clouds.'
'Come on, you can do it!'
'It doesn't matter how hard you try, you can't\njust make thermals appear.'
'That bird of prey, a kite, is flying over\nthere.'
'It would be good if the glider could flap its\nwings like a bird...'
'That's why I said that they should have an\nengine...'
'What is it, Yoru?'
'Looks like it's coming this way.'
'Huh...? You're right, it's coming towards us...'
'Come on! Do your best!'
'...That's strange, there are no clouds like that\nin the sky over here either.'
'Do your very best!'
'You were right, Kotori!'
'Yeah, no doubt about it! Even with the\nbinoculars, it still looks tiny though!'
In response to Kotori's transmission, we headed\nacross the lake towards Windmill Hill.
There should be some thermals over there.
'But, there aren't any clouds that seem to\nindicate thermals.'
'Just because there are thermals, it doesn't\nalways mean that clouds are formed.'
'I think that could be because the hill is on a\nslope.'
'Do you mean that thermals occur more easily\nabove slopes?'
'Yeah.'
'The sunlight hits the ground diagonally, right?\nBut if the surface is also diagonal, the sunlight\nhits it directly.'
'This concentrates the energy, warming it more\neasily.'
It's true, the sloping surface of the hill that\nwe are heading towards is shining from being in\nthe direct light of the morning sun.
'How is it, Kotori?'
'It's there, I found it! It's a lot higher than\nthe one just now!'
'There's no mistaking it, I can see a kite!!'
We can't confirm that from where we are right\nnow, but it seems that a kite is flying above the\nhill.
Kites are birds that glide to high altitudes\nusing upward drafts.
In other words, there is a thermal over there.
However, that doesn't necessarily mean there is\nenough lift to raise a heavy double-seater\nglider.
But there's nothing else left for us to try.
I didn't think of anything other than aiming for\nthat point.
Eventually, the glider crossed the lake, and\napproached the air above Windmill Hill.
FWOOOSH!!
'Waaah!'
'Whoa!!'
Suddenly, we were shaken vertically.
The variometer told us that the glider had\ndropped sharply.
...We've been caught in a downward draft!?
I panicked, and the next moment...
...we felt a huge impact.
'We're rising!'
Suddenly, it felt like we were being pushed from\nbelow, and the glider steadily floated upwards.
Then, a little later, the variometer informs us\nthat we are rising.
We had ridden a thermal.
'It's pretty strong! We can do this, Amane!!'
'Yeah!'
'Ah ha! They're climbing, they're climbing! Look,\nAgeha!!'
'Oh, so they are. That's great, they've gotten up\nso high already.'
'See, there was one after all!'
'Yeah, way to go, Kotori!'
'Eh heh heh! It's nice getting praise!'
'Does it look like they can climb all the way\nup?'
'They've got pretty strong lift, I think they can\nmake it.'
'Take care of Amane.'
'Leave it to me.'
'Alright, go on! To the other side of the\nclouds!'
'Yeah! On the wings that you guys made!'
'Amazing... They've gone up so high...'
'How can they fly so high just by riding the\nwind?'
'If you want to know the theory, I can tell you.\nDo you want to hear it?'
'No, it's OK... Even if you tell me, I won't\nunderstand it. Also...'
'...I don't think that something like that can be\nexplained with theory.'
'Ha! Without theory, something that big would\nnever be able to fly.'
'Amazing... Yeah, it's amazing.'
Before we knew it, the powerful thermals\noccurring above Windmill Hill had lifted us high\nup in the sky.
We were getting closer and closer to the Morning\nGlory.
'We're getting closer, Amane.'
'Yeah...'
The clouds that, from below, looked small and\nintermittent, were actually pretty big when we\ngot close to them.
I wonder how wide they are? At the very least,\nthey would comfortably be able to cover the width\nof this glider.
They stretched out to around the distance needed\nto go diagonally across the lake.
'It's a little far, isn't it...'
'It's OK. If we can keep going above the clouds,\nit should be easy to pass across them.'
The thermal that we were riding was pretty\npowerful.
As Amane had just explained, the slope of the\nhill is hit directly by the sunlight, so it heats\nup quickly.
In other words, that means that the difference in\ntemperature is bigger compared to the surrounding\narea.

If there is no difference in temperature, then
thermals will not be created, and if the
difference is big, then strong thermals will be
made.
The upward draft that Kotori had found for us\nfeels strong enough to take us all the way to the\nhorizon.
While this is happening, the sun is rising, and\nthe air temperature is increasing.
Morning Glory occurs for about two hours from the\nbeginning of dawn.
'(C'mon... C'mon...)'
I'm getting impatient.
However, if we try too hard, we'll lose balance,\nand we might lose altitude.
While checking the rate of ascent on the\nvariometer, I turn the glider to aim for the core\nof the thermal, the most effective part.
Eventually...
The glider that Amane and I were riding reached\nthe altitude of the Morning Glory that we were\naiming for.
Then, we had soon risen above that, and reached a\nposition where we could view it from above.
'Look, Amane!'
'Yeah... I can see it.'
I knew she'd be looking at it, but I said it\nanyway.
It's because I was so moved.
Is there anyone who wouldn't be moved to see a\nspectacle like this?
With the bluish-purple sky in the background, the\npassage of clouds shone as they were bathed in\nthe pale pink sunlight.
Words like 'beautiful' wouldn't really express it\nat all.
The word that came to mind was 'divine'.
My trembling hands gripped the yoke to gain an\naltitude to allow us to stay above the clouds, I\nturn into the thermal.
I glanced at the front seat, and I saw Amane from\nthe side.
Her eyes were opened wide like a little kid's as\nshe looked at the passage of clouds stretching\nacross the sky.
'This is the view that Isuka wanted to show\nme...'
'To bring me... to this place...'
'Amane, can you get the camera?'
'O...oh yeah, that's right.'
Before we took off, Ageha had given her a digital\ncamera.
She asked us to take a picture if we were able to\nfly above the Morning Glory.
This was the perfect viewpoint, looking across\nthe clouds.
'I've taken it.'
'Alright, let's go. To that place.'
'...Yeah.'
Amane nodded as if preparing herself.
We didn't come here to look at the clouds.
We came to pass across them.
Once we had gained enough altitude, I tilted the\nyoke and turned the glider.
Now, it's time for us to go!
The airflow here was calm, and we could fly\nwithout being shaken by crosswinds.
In the upper parts of the sky, there were hardly\nany clouds, and the clear light blue gradient\nspread out in all directions.
While paying attention to our rate of descent, we\ntraveled along the space of crystal-clear light.
We are approaching the passage of light.
A rolling airflow occurs around the clouds, and\nif we can ride that, we can pass along the\npassage of clouds as far as we want.
'We've finally arrived...'
The Morning Glory was right there, at our\nfingertips.
...And as I thought that...
...all of a sudden, it happened.
As our view swung round, the divine road of cloud\nthat should've been there in front of us, in the\nspace of a moment, was getting further away.
We suddenly lost lift, and then a few moments\nlater, we realized that the glider was rapidly\ndescending.
I quickly pulled at the yoke but there was no\nresponse.
The field of vision span round, and we couldn't\neven figure out if we were facing up or down.
'(...What is this? What's going on!!?)'
Is it a stall?
However, there were no signs that was going to\nhappen.
It was just like...
Yes, it was just like there was no air and we had\nlost all of our lift.
...We're falling!
'What is it, what happened?'
'They're falling!'
'No way! Give me the binoculars!!'
'...This is bad, what happened!?'
'Aoi, Aoi, come in! Aoi...!!!!!'
'Aoi, Aoi, come in! Aoi...!!!!!'
'Urrggghhhhh...!!! I can't... deal with that\nright now...'
The surface of the lake appeared from the other\nside of the canopy.
We were falling with the nose pointing straight\ndown.
'I'll level it out!!'
In the heat of the moment, I didn't know which\ncontrols I used...
Anyway, I tried to lift the nose up and stabilize\nthe wings.
'WHOOOOOOOAAAAAAHHHHH!!!!!!!!'
FWOOOSH!!
A shock ran through me that felt like the\nfuselage might be crushed.
To us, the pilots, the vibrations passed through\nour bodies, and for a moment, I thought that we\nhad crashed.
'Haaa... haaa... Are we OK...?'
'Looks like it...'
The nose and the wings leveled out and the glider\nhad gained lift and was floating.
We were 200 meters from the surface of the water.
In a moment, we had fallen almost 800 meters.
If it was a few seconds later, it would've been\ntoo late...
My whole body trembled with fear and relief.
'Are you alright, Amane?'
'Yeah, somehow...'
Her shoulders were shaking but her reply was OK.
'What the hell happened just now...?'
The were no signs that the airflow had become\nseparated from the main wings, in other words, a\nstall.
It is often said that it can occur without\nwarning, but for it to occur somewhere that had\nsuch stable airflow...
'...We might have been caught in a strong\ndownward draft.'
'You mean just now?'
If that were true, it was pretty strong. Do\nthings like this really happen?
'In the summer, in the vicinity of the center of\nlakes or big rivers, it seems that sometimes\ndownbursts occur.'
Downbursts are powerful downward drafts.
If a downburst, a giant mass of air, falls to\nearth, it is powerful enough to cause severe\ndamage.
'If we were swallowed by something like that, we\nwouldn't stand a chance...'
The place where we were, was in the vicinity of\nthe center of a lake, like Amane was saying.
We were so distracted by the Morning Glory, that\nwas we lost sight of our own position.
Because of the lake, the air cools, and it's\npossible that a strong downward draft would be\ncreated.
If the air itself falls down, a glider, which\nfloats using the power of the air, would have no\nchoice but to be taken down with it.
That might be why we lost lift and fell, suddenly\nand without any warning signs.
'Aoi! Amane! Please come respond!!'
We heard Kotori's tearful voice over the radio.
'We're OK. Somehow we managed to level it out.'
'What a relief...'
'What on earth happened?'
'We don't know. Amane said that we might've been\ncaught in a strong downward draft.'
'A little more and we would be upside-down in the\nlake.'
'H...hey, Kotori's heart's gonna stop, you know!'
'S...sorry. But we're alright now.'
'Phew...'
'What was that? What happened?'
'I don't know. It could've been a malfunction...\nor they were caught in a strong downward draft.'
'Yes, somehow they managed to level it out before\nthey fell.'
'Whew...'
'That was really close. If they were any later,\nthey would've died.'
'I guess... It's dangerous for people to fly\nthrough the air.'
'Yes.'
'For humans, who don't have wings, to aim for the\nsky, they need to be brave. It's dangerous too.\nBut even so, people, who can't fly...'
'...The Morning Glory!'
I quickly looked above.
The place where we were just now, is much further\naway.
It's dazzling to think that we were so high up.
'Let's go up one more time!'
'It's no good, Aoi. We won't make it in time.'
'Really? We won't know unless we try!'
As I shouted, I looked to the sky.
At some point, the dawn sky had disappeared, and\nthe sky was now filled with a clear, blue color.
Exposed to the sunlight, the passage of cloud was\nnothing like it was at the beginning, and was\nthinning out, and gradually disappearing.
I turn the glider towards Windmill Hill.
If we have the powerful thermal from before, we\nmight be able to make it.
I will take Amane there!
'That's enough for now.'
'We weren't able to go to that place but I was\nable to see... even if just for a short time, the\nsight that Isuka wanted to show me.'
'That is enough.'
'Amane...'
Amane looked through the canopy at the clouds\nabove.
'...This is goodbye.'
Amane's whisper, along with the passage of cloud,\nfaded away into the sky.
